VLIB_afast12_detectCorners

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_afast12_detectCorners (const uint8_t *img, int32_t img_width, int32_t img_height, int32_t img_pitch, int32_t marginPixels, uint8_t differenceThreshold, CORB_Bool sortResults, CORBFeature *restrict features, uint16_t *restrict scratchBuff)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_afast12_detectCorners ( const uint8_t *  img,
int32_t  img_width,
int32_t  img_height,
int32_t  img_pitch,
int32_t  marginPixels,
uint8_t  differenceThreshold,
CORB_Bool  sortResults,
CORBFeature *restrict  features,
uint16_t *restrict  scratchBuff 
)

Description:
Accelerated FAST12. This function detects and returns corners in image img based on FAST12 algorithm, but in a more DSP friendly manner.
Parameters:
[in] *img Pointer to the image buffer - Must be double-word(64-bit) aligned.
[in] img_width Image width - Must be a multiple of 8.
[in] img_height Image height - Must be a multiple of 8.
[in] img_pitch Image pitch - Number of bytes between the beginning of each line in memory. Must be a multiple of 8.
[in] marginPixels Fast corners will not be found within this distance from the edge of the image
[in] differenceThreshold The FAST difference threshold. A pixel must be this much brighter/darker than the center to be considered "different"
[in] sortResults By default, the feature list is sorted only in y direction, not x. Setting this to TRUE causes the features list to be sorted in both x and y directions. For non-maxima suppression, the sort operation must be performed, so the list is sorted is x and y. However, this function is faster to not sort.
[out] *features Pointer to a buffer to hold feature locations(x,y) - Must be double-word(64-bit) aligned. Size depends on max features in the use case.
[in] *scratchBuff Internal scratch buffer of size = img_width elements (img_width * 2 bytes)
Assumptions:
  • img and features must both be double-word(64-bit) aligned.
  • img_width and img_height must both be a multiple of 8 and not less than CORB_MIN_IMAGE_WIDTH and CORB_MIN_IMAGE_HEIGHT, respectively.
  • img_pitch must be a multiple of 8 and not less than CORB_MIN_IMAGE_WIDTH.
  • Max number of features to find is set to CORB_MAX_FEATURES, therefore, the features buffer should be allocated CORB_MAX_FEATURES*sizeof(CORBFeature)
Implementation Notes:
  • This code is compatible with C6XXX fixed point processors.
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
